resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete the JSON-file?
Are you sure you want to delete the location entry?
You have not discovered any signals yet!
The app requires at least the permission to access the microphone. Otherwise it cannot detect ultrasonic signals.

Technologies like Google Nearby and Silverpush build upon ultrasonic sounds to exchange data (data over audio). More and more of our devices communicate via this inaudible communication channel. Every device with a microphone and a speaker is able to send and receive ultrasonic information. Users are usually not aware of this inaudible and hidden data transfer. 

SoniControl is a novel technology for the recognition and masking of acoustic ultrasound communication. SoniControl detects ultrasonic communication, notifies the user and blocks the information on demand. Thereby, SoniControl helps end-users to protect their privacy from potential audio tracking. 

The project SoniControl has been financially supported by the funding program netidee (http://www.netidee.at) and has been developed in a research project at the Institute for Creative Media Technologies at the University of Applied Sciences Sankt PÃ¶lten (http://sonicontrol.fhstp.ac.at). The entire project is open source under GNU license. 

Privacy statement: SoniControl does not send any data from the users to other places and works even completely offline. All program data are stored locally on the phone. SoniControl requires microphone access to listen to the ultrasonic channel (all hearable information is filtered out). It further requires location information if the user wants the app to block ultrasonic communication permanently at a certain location (e.g. near to an audio beacon mounted next to some building). 

In case of questions, bugs, ideas, please contact us directly under http://sonicontrol.fhstp.ac.at/#contact or sonicontrol@fhstp.ac.at.

Credits 

 Audio by Superpowered (http://www.superpowered.com/)

Material Icons used, which are under the license of Apache License Version 2.0 (https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.txt )

Data collection and data processing:

 - We use the microphone to capture sound, but process only the ultrasonic part, we remove everything under 17kHz.

 - Sounds are analyzed in real time on the phone. They are not sent to the web, nor stored on the phone.

 - Detections are stored locally in a JSON file, including the time and location (if allowed by the user). The user can delete this file at any time via the Settings menu.

 - If allowed, we check the user's location regularly in order to tell him when he enters an area where he previously detected ultrasonic communications.

Welcome to the SoniControl firewall.

SoniControl scans for ultrasonic messages coming from other phones or audio beacons in your environment and notifies you about such detections. On a detection you can choose to block the messages (also future messages at the same location) or to let it pass. 

SoniControl needs access to the microphone to work properly, and to your location (optional) to remember places where ultrasounds should be blocked. 

We do not transmit any data from your phone and do not store privacy-sensitive data.

Tap the play button to start scanning for ultrasonic signals.
To save/see locations where ultrasonic communications were detected, you need to check the \'Save data in JSON file\' setting
To save locations where ultrasonic communications were detected, you need to turn on location. \nYou can turn on Location in \'Phone Settings\'
Location was not found and latest detection couldn\'t be saved
We could not start scanning, the microphone is already used by another app.
Please activate location if you want to be able to save detections.
Do you want to reset all settings?
You have not imported any signals yet!

Detections are shown in four tabs: \"My Rules\", \"Imported Rules\", \"Detection History\" and a map visualization. The first two act as firewall rules. Their color shows if the rule will be blocked (red), ignored (green) or ask you again on the next detection (orange). You can change the status by tapping on them several times. On tapping longer on them, you can delete each rule. The history tab shows all detections.\nThe map shows all firewall rules geographically.
